title: League is like Rock, Paper, Scissors.
body: Except for each Rock, Paper, and Scissors there is a better version of it. Super Rock, Super Paper, and Super Scissors. Why the fuck would I pick Rock, Paper, or Scissors when there is literally a better version of all of them?

replies.body:
I love playing Heimerdinger, but why play him when Azir does everything he does, only better?

Zoning? Check (and not hard countered by waveclear)
Poke? Check
Burst? Check
Bait potential? Check

he has Heimers niche covered with an insec to boot.

I mean, I agree, but the simple answer is "cos heim is easier"
The really question is, is that a sufficient reason, or an excuse?

He is easier to play, yeah, but also easier to utterly destroy.

Heimer has almost zero good matchups, and (in the right hands) almost every champion in the game can be a hard counter.
You forget that Heimer is incredibly frustrating to play against and he tends to suck the fun out of the "game" when you have to lane against him
{{champion:268}}
Remind me how Azir doesn't do that either?
Pls, play vs Irelia - that's truly frustrating match.
I hate that champion with a fiery passion.
Irelia is kinda fun to fight but herindinger is just kinda untouchable, same for azir.
You think? Maybe I'm just more open to fighting Heim since I main mid and have a better idea of the matchup, but playing against Irelia makes me very sad. ]:
If you join a team please name it 'definitely'.
Just for you

heimer has more utility.

his ult with three options is the reason why heimer can compete, you can pick whether you want to initiate, obliterate one target, or put down what amounts to another adc in a teamfight. all of course while keeping in consideration that you keep a small facet of every part of that regardless of what you choose. you still chunk even if you chose to initiate, and you still have your small zone turrets as well.

heimer also has better objective control than azir, turrets hitting towers and staying up like your do is a good thing. it's just that those strengths are looked over and not utilized, and heimer is weak to characters that go in and go out fast, which there is an overabundance of.

Can Azir dps while using Hourglass? Or have both sweeper/orb as his trinket yet still have the ability to give his team something to TP to? Hard CC his enemies without blowing his ult? I think not.

Am I being hopelessly sarcastic and conjuring up pointless or unrealistic scenarios? Who knows?

See, you get it. It's hard to explain this to some of my friends. 

You guys can enjoy playing regular paper, but it'll never be as good as Super Paper. Unless Super Paper literally becomes worse than regular paper.

I always found that really strange about Rock, Paper, Scissors.  Why does paper beat rock?  Rock can easily tear through paper.

> [{quoted}](name=Remlap1223,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZY3LzZZ4,comment-id=0008000100000000,timestamp=2016-06-13T18:11:34.096+0000)
>
> I always found that really strange about Rock, Paper, Scissors.  Why does paper beat rock?  Rock can easily tear through paper.

Rock can tear through paper but if you drop a boulder on a piece of paper, it doesn't tear it. All it does is land on it. You can later raise the boulder and the paper might be scratched but it's still fine. Also, paper folds over a rock, making it useless and a lot more harmless.
Also Paper builds like Rock and now is also good against Scissors too

Because I like rock and don't want to learn super rock because super rock doesn't give me the same feeling.
Well, then you can enjoy playing regular rock while everyone climbs soloq with Super Rock.
What's a SoloQ?

Almost every champion has something a little unique about them. People say that champs like wukong and xin are identical because they dive the backline but xin is better at singling one person out while wukong does massive damage to the entire team.

How about this one. In patch 6.9 when Malz first came out. Why would anybody pick Nunu over Malz? Nunu is unique compared to Malz and has different abilities so why did nobody play Nunu jungle and everybody played Malz jungle?
Nunu is a boring champion and malzahar was ridiculously broken. Nunu still has some of the best objective control though.
I think Malz has better objective control, damage, and cc than Nunu though. Why would anybody pick Nunu over Malz?
Where's Malz's Q-Smite? How does the full tank Malz build fare?
How does Malz have better objective control than someone who can buff his and his adc's attack speed and basically has two smites?

> [{quoted}](name=dapcutscene,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZY3LzZZ4,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-06-13T06:02:15.657+0000)
>
> How about this one. In patch 6.9 when Malz first came out. Why would anybody pick Nunu over Malz? Nunu is unique compared to Malz and has different abilities so why did nobody play Nunu jungle and everybody played Malz jungle?

Ahem.

Malzahar can't solo Rift Herald (which got a massive buff in 6.9) due to the way the Herald's patience meter works.

Now, Nunu generally can't solo it either (Herald fucking HURTS now) but he can take it much earlier with his top laner.

> [{quoted}](name=Chicken Sailor,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZY3LzZZ4,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-13T05:04:45.038+0000)
>
> Almost every champion has something a little unique about them. People say that champs like wukong and xin are identical because they dive the backline but xin is better at singling one person out while wukong does massive damage to the entire team.

too much overlap

in dota every champion is actually unique and ridiculously good at that one thing they do

dota doesn't have any "Generically good at everything" type bruisers

> Why the fuck would I pick Rock, Paper, or Scissors when there is literally a better version of all of them?

Right then- if that's so simple
{{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:18}} 
Pick the best one. No no- don't just say "The pros pick this one" tell me which one is the "better version" and why.
You can't, because they all bring different things.
Tons of AoE CC? Ashe.
Long range and zoning? Caitlyn.
Longer range and a lot of damage? Jhin.
Excellent waveclear and team mobility boost? Sivir.
Upfront burst and a reset-able dash? Lucian.
Poke and slipperiness? Ezreal.
True damage to mess up anyone late-game? Vayne.
and so on. There is no "super scissors". Riot is working to make every champion distinct, surprise, that takes a lot of time.

Also because, I don't know, you might like the individual champion? I main Malzahar, Nami, and Lux- all of which have been referred to as "sub-par" at times. I main them because I like Malzahar's ability to lock one person down and destroy them. I like Nami because I enjoy the bouncing water and playing around it. I like Lux because I love the idea of an armored mage running around in the thick of combat (Not how Lux is meant to be used but I make it work).
League is more than just the competitive scene you know- some people play for fun.

Isn't Jhin a better version of Cait?
I mean, he's also very good at zoning while also offering a lot of damage. The only thing he lacks is mobility and the ability to point and click his ult, but in exchange he gets 4 ult shots.
